name: ServiceNow Outbound Connector
description: Execute CRUD operations on any ServiceNow table

properties.label: Instance name
properties.description: Enter only the instance name from your ServiceNow URL

properties.label: Operation
properties.description: Choose operation type

properties.label: Target table
properties.description: Choose a table for the record operation

properties.label: Enter table name
properties.description: Type the exact ServiceNow table name (case-sensitive)

properties.label: Query parameters (sysparm_query)
properties.description: Separate multiple conditions with '^' (Ex: active=true^priority=1)

properties.label: Fields to return (sysparm_fields)
properties.description: Comma-separated field names (Ex: sys_id, number, short_description)

properties.label: Result limit (sysparm_limit)
properties.description: The maximum number of records to return (Ex: 10)

properties.label: Sys ID of the record to update
properties.description: Enter the unique record identifier (sys_id) to update

properties.label: Sys ID of the record to delete
properties.description: Enter the unique record identifier (sys_id) to delete

properties.//: this sets the actual request body for a write request to the ServiceNow API

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Choose the authentication type. Select 'None' if no authentication is necessary

properties.label: Api key location
properties.description: Choose type: Send API key in header or as query parameter.

properties.label: OAuth 2.0 token endpoint
properties.description: The OAuth token endpoint

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: Your application's client ID from the OAuth client

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: Your application's client secret from the OAuth client

properties.label: Audience
properties.description: The unique identifier of the target API you want to access

properties.label: Client authentication
properties.description: Send client ID and client secret as Basic Auth request in the header, or as client credentials in the request body

properties.label: Scopes
properties.description: The scopes which you want to request authorization for (e.g.read:contacts)

properties.label: URL
Headers
properties.description: Map of HTTP headers to add to the request

properties.label: Query parameters
properties.description: Map of query parameters to add to the request URL
properties.value: ={ "sysparm_query": if sysparm_query != null then replace(sysparm_query, " ", "") else null , "sysparm_fields": if sysparm_fields != null then replace(sysparm_fields, " ", "") else null , "sysparm_limit": if sysparm_limit != null then sysparm_limit else null }

properties.label: Store response
properties.description: Store the response as a document in the document store

properties.label: Skip URL encoding
properties.description: Skip the default URL decoding and encoding behavior

properties.label: Connection timeout in seconds
properties.description: Defines the connection timeout in seconds, or 0 for an infinite timeout

properties.label: Read timeout in seconds
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to read data from an established connection or 0 for an infinite timeout

properties.label: Result variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.label: Error expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Retries
properties.description: Number of retries

properties.label: Retry backoff
properties.description: ISO-8601 duration to wait between retries
